sentence.Network_en: She does a bit of waitressing as a part-time job.
sentence.Network_cn: 她有时兼职做一下服务员。

entry.def: If someone is a part-time worker or has a part-time job, they work for only part of each day or week.

example.ex: Many businesses are cutting back by employing lower-paid part-time workers...
example.tran: 很多企业通过雇用薪金低廉的兼职工人来减少开支。

example.ex: Part-time work is generally hard to find...
example.tran: 一般说来，兼职工作很难找。

means.word_mean: 1. involving less than the standard or customary time for an activity;
1. for less than the standard number of hours;

auth_sentence.content: Many players juggle both domestic handball and part-time employment.

sentences.en: It was a long haul doing the degree part-time, but it was worth it.
sentences.cn: 在职攻读学位的过程虽然费时很长且很辛苦,但是非常值得。

sentences.en: He supplements his income with part-time or home work.
sentences.cn: 他靠兼职或在家工作来贴补收入。

sentences.en: A lot of mothers choose to work part-time.
sentences.cn: 许多母亲选择做兼职工作。

sentences.en: She works part-time in a shop.
